pr_title: Merge contigs into fewer GenomicsDB partitions

timeline.message: Make VCFCodec the default for query streams from GenomicsDB and other minor changes

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            throw new UserException(MERGE_CONTIGS_INTO_NUM_PARTITIONS+" requires that entire contigs " +
          
          
            
                            throw new UserException("--" + MERGE_CONTIGS_INTO_NUM_PARTITIONS + " requires that entire contigs " +
timeline.author: lbergelson
lbergelson
lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: I know this is just moving but there a few minor things that can be updated here.
timeline.author: lbergelson
lbergelson
lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: It's weird that the workspace is passed into here, but then the createParitionWithBeginAndEnd uses the workspace field to get it.  I would make both static and pass workspace through to createPartitionWithBeginAndEnd, otherwise someone will be very confused when they try pass a different workspace value into this function I think.
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: Alternatively remove the workspace parameter from this method so it's consistent.
replies.author: lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: this would probably be clearer with a foreach instead of an indexed loop since the indexes are unimportant
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: It could also be a single streaming expression like the method below but that's really a stylistic choice and I don't care much either way...
replies.author: lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: While we're here could we move the "setContig" call from here, up to where contigPositionBuilder is initialized?  I think it would make it clearer.
timeline.author: lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: This method uses the workspace field, lets make them all consistent 1 way or another.  (I always like static methods but most of the existing methods are non-static and use the workspace field directly.)
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: changed the methods to use the class members directly
replies.author: mlathara

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we should pull out a constant BOUNDS_START and BOUNDS_END for these to make it clear the array is always structured the same way?  A pair of some sort might be a clearer api for returning these values.
timeline.author: lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: Always attach the underlying exception as the cause.  It makes debugging way easier.
timeline.author: lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: I always like foreach when index is irrelevant.
timeline.author: lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: Don't we still want to output the log messages even if we're getting intervals from an existing workspace?  Why does this need to short circuit here?  It seems like we could drop this whole condition because the initializeInputPreloadExecutorService method now guards against null intervals as well.
timeline.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: yup - don't need to short circuit anymore as you say. added a log.info and specific to getIntervalsFromExistingWorkspace (we don't touch the jsons or workspace otherwise in that case)
replies.author: mlathara

timeline.bodyText: I would make these less stateful by returning the list of intervals instead of modifying it in place.
timeline.author: lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: Similarly, this seems like it could return the value instead of modifying the field.
timeline.author: lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: I think you can avoid this funky collect -> stream if you use flat map above instead of map.
timeline.author: lbergelson

timeline.message: adding tests with many contigs to several where some contigs are empty, interval list nonadjacent
